title.value: CRYCELEB: A SPEAKER VERIFICATION DATASET BASED ON INFANT CRY SOUNDS
title.justification: The title is provided at the top of the paper.
title.quote: CRYCELEB: A SPEAKER VERIFICATION DATASET BASED ON INFANT CRY SOUNDS

extractions.description: This paper describes the Ubenwa CryCeleb dataset, a labeled collection of infant cries, and the accompanying CryCeleb 2023 task, a public speaker verification challenge based on cry sounds. More than 6 hours of cry sounds from 786 newborns were released for academic use to encourage research in infant cry analysis.

type.justification: The paper presents a dataset (Ubenwa CryCeleb), describes its collection and annotation process, reports baseline results from a machine learning challenge (CryCeleb 2023), and summarizes the performance of different systems participating in the challenge.
type.quote: This paper describes the Ubenwa CryCeleb dataset - a labeled collection of infant cries - and the accompanying CryCeleb 2023 task, which is a public speaker verification challenge based on cry sounds.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on the analysis and verification of audio recordings of infant cries.
name.quote: Index Terms— Infant Cry Analysis, Speaker Verification, Audio Dataset

name.justification: The dataset and challenge described in the paper focus on speaker verification, specifically verifying the identity of infants based on their cry sounds.
name.quote: the accompanying CryCeleb 2023 task, which is a public speaker verification challenge based on cry sounds.

name.justification: The paper aims to advance research in infant cry analysis by providing a labeled dataset of infant cries, which can be used for tasks beyond verification, such as detecting health pathologies.
name.quote: more broadly and importantly, to advance the field of infant cry analysis using verification as a proxy task

name.justification: The baseline model used in the experiments is the ECAPA-TDNN speaker verification model.
name.quote: The baseline is a state-of-the-art ECAPA-TDNN speaker verification model

is_contributed.justification: The model was used as a baseline in the experiments but was not introduced or developed in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: The baseline is a state-of-the-art ECAPA-TDNN speaker verification model

is_executed.justification: The model was executed as part of the experimental setup for the CryCeleb 2023 challenge.
is_executed.quote: trained using a large adult speaker verification corpus - VoxCeleb [9] without any adaptation on cry data

is_compared.justification: The performance of the ECAPA-TDNN model was compared to other participant models in the CryCeleb 2023 challenge.
is_compared.quote: Table 5 summarizes the performance of two baselines on dev and test sets and the following section provides more details about these systems.

referenced_paper_title.value: ECAPA-TDNN: Emphasized channel attention, propagation and aggregation in TDNN based speaker verification
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced title for the ECAPA-TDNN model is explicitly given in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: ECAPA-TDNN: Emphasized channel attention, propagation and aggregation in TDNN based speaker verification

name.justification: The primary dataset discussed and contributed by this paper is the Ubenwa CryCeleb dataset, which consists of labeled infant cries.
name.quote: This paper describes the Ubenwa CryCeleb dataset - a labeled collection of infant cries

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no other reference paper for this dataset as it is originally contributed by this paper.

name.justification: The ECAPA-TDNN baseline model used in the paper was pre-trained on the VoxCeleb dataset.
name.quote: VoxCeleb model (the baseline described above) is fine-tuned on CryCeleb training data

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced title for the VoxCeleb dataset is explicitly given in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote:
J. S. Chung, A. Nagrani, and A. Zisserman, 
“Voxceleb2: Deep speaker recognition,” in INTERSPEECH, 2018.

name.justification: The paper utilizes the SpeechBrain library for implementing the ECAPA-TDNN baseline model.
name.quote: We refer to the open-source SpeechBrain implementation [10] for further details with the model available in Hugging Face

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced title for the SpeechBrain library is explicitly given in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Mirco Ravanelli et al., “SpeechBrain: A general-purpose speech toolkit,” 2021, arXiv:2106.04624
